patterns: How can I create a report?
responses: After you login, you will go to the home page. You will see blank and template pages, and you can choose the one that fits your case. Then, you will choose the category that your report belongs to. Once you finish writing your report, you can save it, and it will be saved into the reports pages. You can edit or check it later. I hope this helps.

patterns: How can I delete a report?
responses: After creating and saving the report, it will be available on the 'Reports' page which can be accessed via the button on your homepage. Once on the 'Reports' page, you can select the report you wish to delete and click the 'Delete' button. The report will be permanently deleted. I hope this helps!

responses: Sorry, but you cannot log in as an admin or clerk. The admin is responsible for managing the system, which includes adding and deleting users, while the clerk is responsible for improving the system based on feedback. I hope this helps clarify their roles. <3

patterns: Why do I have to choose a category every time?
What is the purpose of the category?
responses: We have two categories in our system: Medical, Research, and Psychotherapy. These categories are used to help predict the next word you may need to type. If you require specific words related to medical or psychotherapy, please choose the respective category. If not, choose the general category for a broader range of word options. I hope this clears up any confusion. <3

patterns: How can I edit my previous report?
How can I edit a report?
responses: In the 'My Reports' section of your homepage, you can search for the report you want to edit. Click on the report and make the necessary changes. Once you've finished editing, save the changes, and the updated report will be saved in this section.

patterns: How can I change my profile information?

responses: In your navbar, you'll see your profile icon on the right. Click on it, and you'll see your profile information. Click the 'Edit' button to go to the edit section, where you can edit your email or password, or both.
